isis.stitle: REPAIR INSTRUCTIONS FOR FIBERGLASS AND PLASTIC (ABS) MATERIAL - PLASTIC (ABS) - FINISHING

svcproc.title: FINISHING
svcproc.para: After the repair has been completed, paint the area. Even though a number of air-drying enamels can be used, there is no universal paint which will adhere to thermoplastic. Most thermoplastic repairs require a special primer such as Sikkens Autocryl Filler for the paint to stick. If the thermoplastic has a sprayed on texture match the repair texture to the surrounding area with a texturing primer such as Dynatron/Bondo Corp. Dyna-Fill. Primers of this variety are to be applied and left to dry. DO NOT finish sand these primers.

After priming, paint with Sikkens Autocryl Color followed by their Matting Clear. The gloss level can be adjusted by mixing it with Sikkens Auto Clear. Paint the repaired area so it blends in with the surrounding area.
For more painting information refer to GROUP 16 - PAINT section in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
